page.title: 17HAWICK COMMON RIDING.
page.content: The Common Riding is the re-enactment of the former Riding of the "Marches" (Borderers) of the common land of the people of Hawick.The commemoration, has through the years become somewhat embellished and parts of the ceremony today relate to an alleged incident following the Battle of Flodden. The principals in the Common Riding are the Cornet and the Acting Father, the former representing the leader of the young able bodied men and the latter the senior magistrate or burgess of the town.The actual riding of the boundaries takes place on the 2nd last day of the festivities but this is preceded by 6 Rideouts where the principals and male mounted supporters visit outlying villages. A Race Meeting is the culmination of the festivities at the Moor.This is a family day in the form of a picnic.
